JobFullDesc:
Primary Function of Position:
Ensures service activities are performed and implemented per service agreements and warranty obligations.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Ensure Service Contract Obligations and commitments are met and adhered to Preventive Maintenance, Service, Upgrades, etc.
Manage day to day business, which includes but not limited to; Call Management, Call Escalation, Resource dispatch, problem accounts, and establishment of priorities.
Evaluate inventory levels.
Drive timely resolution of field service issues and closure of Customer Communications.
Ensure Field Service staff is appropriately trained.
Monitor staffing requirements to ensure proper resources are in place to effectively support and resolve Field Service issues.
Support trade show activity.
Ensure FE documentation is submitted and accurate; Field Activity Reports, Return Material Authorizations, Expense Reports, etc.
Work closely with Sales Organization to ensure customer expectations are met.
Drive improvements of service processes and efficiencies.
Support trade show activity.

Skill/Job Requirements: 

4 year degree in Electronics or Biomedical Engineering. 
Minimum 7 years field experience working as a field service representative with 3 years as a manager/supervisor in the medical industry.
Familiarity of O.R. protocols, anatomic terminology and knowledge a plus.
Ability to multi-task and adapt to change without losing focus of priorities.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Need excellent knowledge of English language.
Strong initiative in decision making and assumptions of responsibilities.
Base knowledge of computers and standard software applications.
Willing to travel up to 50% - 75%.
